revised_title: Pathological Effects of Ultra-Violet Radiation on Mosquito Larvae
tldr: The author investigates the effects of ultra-violet radiation on mosquito larvae and finds that they are highly susceptible to injury from unshielded mercury-arc lamps. The larvae exhibit irritation and eventually partial paralysis, leading to death within a few days. The study helps determine the wave-length range responsible for these effects and provides insights into mosquito biology and potential applications in controlling mosquito populations.
